FuncDef:
The priority command configures the forwarding priority of the packets received on an MP-Group interface.
The undo priority command restores the forwarding priority of the packets received on the MP-Group interface to the default value.
By default, the forwarding priority of the packets received on the MP-Group interface is normal.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the packets received on the MP-group interface are forwarded with a high priority.
-

Indicates that the packets received on the MP-group interface are forwarded with a normal priority.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When excessive packets are to be transmitted through the MP-group interface, you can configure the forwarding priority for the packets received on the MP-group interface. In this manner, packets on the MP-group interface can be normally transmitted.
Before configuring the forwarding priority for the packets received on an MP-Group interface, shut down the MP-Group interface.
When the total number of E1 channels that are bound to the MP-Group interfaces configured with forwarding priority is greater than 51, the forwarding priority cannot be configured on other MP-Group interfaces.
Precautions
Only the CR53-P10-2xcPOS/STM1-SFP/CR53-P10-24xcE1/cT1-DB100 subcards support this command.
